subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] I have a question.
author: David Koenig
full_text:
I agree. You need to try every way possible to find the best one.

On Mon, May 18, 2009 at 12:45 PM, April Abercrombie <
april@abercrombieghostresearch.com> wrote:

>
>
>  You just have to play around with it. There is no "right way".
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> *From:* SnowfireL@...
> *To:* EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> *Sent:* Monday, May 18, 2009 8:51 AM
> *Subject:* Re: [EVP-ITC] I have a question.
>
>  *Wish I knew how to "enhance" the correct way, because they sure have a
> lot to say over there, and I all ready had my mom come through loud and
> clear last night again, even a little boy and dad maybe from this
> neighborhood talked directly to me, although for me it sounded like they
> were in a tin can.   There is plenty of other stuff coming through as well,
> what do I care if people don't believe this, I do because, I know this is
> meant to be, and I am sure of it it's going to be something for other's like
> seeing is believing and there is nothing we can do for them, it's like the
> Wright Brother's flying for the first time here people, they said how in the
> world will that big heavy thing get off the ground?  I say lets go for it, a
> machine will be found to make them come in loud and clear one day.  sf*
>
>  In a message dated 5/18/2009 9:13:25 A.M. Eastern Daylight Time,
> evanduzer@... writes:
>
>
>
> Now I may be biased to the "investigation" way of doing things.  I do clean
> up evps if I hear something and can't make it out do to ambient noise.  So
> hear is my question.  When do you stop cleaning up?  Wouldn't to much
> enhancing "taint" the results?  To me the more enhancing you do the less
> convincing it becomes.  I hope no one finds this offensive, it is not meant
> to be I am just really curious.  The way I look at it is that if you have to
> do so much enhancing to find anything, was there really something there to
> begin with.  Are we just making ourselves believe there is something there??
>
> Eric
>
>
